summary: This document is the Second Amendment to the Restated Jeffrey E. Epstein 2001 Trust Two, executed by Jeffrey E. Epstein on December 3, 2004. It amends the trust's distribution provisions to specify multi-million dollar bequests to several named and unnamed individuals upon Epstein's death, with Jean Luc Brunel being the only other named beneficiary.

persons.name: Jeffrey E. Epstein
persons.context: The grantor and creator of the trust who is amending it to specify posthumous distributions to beneficiaries, including Jean Luc Brunel and several unnamed individuals.

persons.name: Jean Luc Brunel
persons.context: Named to receive a $2,000,000 distribution from the trust upon Epstein's death, if living at that time.

persons.name: Lauren J. Kwintner
persons.context: Notary Public for the State of New York who notarized the execution of this trust amendment by Jeffrey E. Epstein.

connections.description: Epstein designated Brunel to receive a $2 million bequest from his trust upon his death, indicating a significant financial connection.

events.title: Execution of Trust Amendment
events.description: Jeffrey E. Epstein executed the Second Amendment to his 2001 Trust Two, notarized by Lauren J. Kwintner, which outlines posthumous financial distributions.

events.title: Prior Trust Amendment
events.description: The trust was previously amended on this date, as referenced in the document's preamble.

events.title: Trust Restatement
events.description: The trust was amended and restated on this date, as referenced in the document's preamble.

keyFacts: Jeffrey E. Epstein's 2004 trust amendment designates a $2 million bequest to Jean Luc Brunel upon Epstein's death, establishing a direct financial link between them.

The document reveals at least seven other intended beneficiaries (all with redacted names) slated to receive bequests ranging from $1 million to $2 million, indicating a network of individuals Epstein sought to financially benefit.

The trust structure shows Epstein's estate planning involved significant discretionary payments to himself during his life and large, conditional distributions to specific individuals after his death.
The execution of the document was notarized in New York by Lauren J. Kwintner on December 3, 2004, providing a clear legal date and jurisdiction for the amendment.
